intro: Sigmatostalix arangoi, commonly known as the Arango's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in complex inflorescences called cyathia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
